intro: Spermacoce mucronata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while the fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Spermacoce mucronata is typically found in disturbed soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats.
